section.heading: Applicability.
section.text: This chapter applies to the issuance of a Tax Credit Certificate for an individual or a corporation to claim a credit against the State Income Tax for the expense of registering a qualified vehicle in the State during the taxable year, as set forth in Tax-General Article, §10-734.1, Annotated Code of Maryland.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
“Qualified vehicle” means a class F (tractor) vehicle described under Transportation Article, §13-923, Annotated Code of Maryland, that is titled and registered in the State.

“Tax Credit Certificate” means a certificate issued by the Administration that certifies, a vehicle owner meets the requirements to claim a credit against the State Income Tax for the expense of registering the qualified vehicle in the State during the taxable year, as set forth under this chapter and in Tax-General Article, §10-734.1, Annotated Code of Maryland.

section.heading: Applying for a Tax Credit Certificate.

para.text: An individual or a corporation seeking a Tax Credit Certificate shall apply for a certificate in a format prescribed by the Administration.
An applicant for a Tax Credit Certificate shall provide the Administration with a completed application, including the title number of the vehicle for which credit is sought.

section.heading: Issuance of a Tax Credit Certificate.

para.text: In accordance with the Tax-General Article, §10-734.1, Annotated Code of Maryland, the Administration shall issue a Tax Credit Certificate.
The Administration may not issue a Tax Credit Certificate, for any taxable year, if:
The required documents are not furnished or the information is incomplete; or
The aggregate amount of Tax Credit Certificates exceeds the amount as set forth under Tax-General Article, §10-734.1(c)(2), Annotated Code of Maryland.
